org.threadly.litesockets

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Server
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TCPServer, UDPServer

    public abstract class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main Server object for litesockets. Any type of connection/open port will use this to create that open port and accept client or send data with it. The Server has an Acceptor callback and a Closer callback. Both the Acceptor and Closer callbacks happen on multiple threads so use thread safety when dealing with those callbacks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Server.ClientAcceptor
      This is the clientAcceptor interface for the Server.
      static interface  Server.ServerCloser
      This is called once a Close is detected on the Servers Socket.

      • accept

        public abstract void accept(java.nio.channels.SelectableChannel c)
        This is how the extending server receives the SelectableChannel. At this point it needs to do what is needed to turn this Channel into A client of some kind.
        Parameters:
        c - The SelectableChannel that was just accepted by this Server.

      • close

        public abstract void close()
        Close this servers Socket. Once closed you must construct a new Server to open it again.
